text: Prättigau/Davos District (, ) is a former administrative district in the canton of Graubünden, Switzerland. It had an area of and has a population of 26,257 in 2015. It was replaced with the Prättigau/Davos Region on 1 January 2017 as part of a reorganization of the Canton.Swiss Federal Statistical Office - Amtliches Gemeindeverzeichnis der Schweiz - Mutationsmeldungen 2016 accessed 16 February 2017 It consists of seven Kreise (sub-districts) and fifteen municipalities: {| border="1" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" style="border: gray solid 1px; border-collapse: collapse;" !colspan="5" align=center bgcolor="#EFEFEF" | Seewis sub-district |- !colspan="1" bgcolor="#EFEFEF" width="160" | Municipality !colspan="1" bgcolor="#EFEFEF" width="140" align="center" | Population () !colspan="1" bgcolor="#EFEFEF" width="100" align="center" | Area (km²) |- | Seewis im Prättigau || align="center" | | align="center" | 49.64 |} The sub-districts Davos, Jenaz, Klosters, Küblis and Luzein belonged until 1986 to the defunct district Oberlandquart; the sub-districts Schiers and Seewis to the defunct district Unterlandquart. ==Mergers== On 1 January 2016 the former municipality of Saas im Prättigau merged into Klosters- Serneus.Amtliches Gemeindeverzeichnis der Schweiz accessed 18 January 2018 ==Languages== {| class="wikitable" |----- | colspan="7" align="center" bgcolor="#FF7F50" | Languages of Prättigau/Davos District, GR |----- | rowspan="2" align="center" | Languages || colspan="2" align="center" | Census 2000 |----- | align="center" | Number || align="center" | Percent |----- |German || align=right | 23,492 || align=right | 89.9% |----- |Romansh || align=right | 285 || align=right | 1.1% |----- |Italian || align=right | 452 || align=right | 1.7% |----- |TOTAL || align=right | 26,130 || align=right | 100% |} ==References== Category:Districts of Graubünden
